title: General Manager
description: Manage the day-to-day operations of the company to ensure smooth operations. Manage all human resources activities such as recruitment, hiring and firing, determining wages, administering disciplinary procedures and other personnel matters. Oversee training of all staff. Review financial statements and sales reports to ensure goals are being achieved. Estimate anticipated expenditures and analyze records of present and past operations, trends, and costs, estimated and realized revenues, administrative commitments and obligations incurred. Oversee the preparation of budgets and financial forecasts and present financial reports to the President for review. Communicate with customers to increase sales and manage the company’s brand. Manage sales reps and ensure they are meeting sales goals. Ensure compliance with all applicable regulations. Oversee and direct all marketing and company branding activities. Telecommuting is available. Employer: E. L. Simeth Co., Inc. ELSCI/GM/CA 12/7/23

title: Assistant Accountant
description: Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related (foreign equivalent not acceptable). Sun, Accountant (AA20904), JZL Inc., 4308 Baldwin Avenue, El Monte, CA 91731. JZLI/AA/CA 11/30/23

title: Design Engineer
description: Read and understand architectural and topography plans. Calculate seismic load based on seismic current code (ASCE 7-16). Calculate building gravity loads and design structural beams, and columns. Design required foundation based on calculated loads and soil report recommendation. Provide required structural detailing. Determine method of LID calculation that fits the project. Provide LID plans and Reports based on assumed method. Calculate volume of the cut and fill for the property. Calculate new elevations based on property needs. Provided grading & drainage plans. 40 hrs/wk, F/T. Req. Masters in Civil Engineering, Construction Management or equivalent. In alternative, Bachelor's in Civil Engineering, Civil Technology Engineering, Construction Management or equivalent plus five years experience as Construction Manager, Structural Engineer, Project Control Supervisor, Technical Supervisor or suitable combo of educ, training and/or exp is acceptable. Mail resume to Safe Structural Engineering, Inc., 23123 Ventura Boulevard, Suite 211, Woodland Hills, CA 91364. Attn: H. Samadzadeh, GM. SSEI/DE/CA 11/17/23

title: Sr. AI Research Engineer
description: Analyze problems, research and develop state-of-the-art machine learning techniques for various applications such as robotics, resource scheduling, drone swarm systems, manned-unmanned teaming, cybersecurity and software defined networking. Apply theoretical expertise and innovation in deep learning/reinforcement learning (DL/RL). Collaborate with software engineers to design and run experiments, including designing and evaluating new algorithms as well as implementing known algorithms. Develop custom DL/RL models and algorithms. Optimize and deploy novel AI solutions on embedded systems. Document design specification, experimentation methodology, and performance results for reports and publication materials such as research papers. Regularly meet with managers to communicate and present results and research findings to senior management. Telecommuting is available. Employer: EpiSys Science, Inc. dba EpiSci. ESI/SAIRE/CA 10/15/23

title: Director of Finance
description: Manage all financial operations of the company including all employees in the finance department. Ensure all company finances are properly managed, accounted for and in compliance with all applicable financial regulations. Direct key finance and reporting operations such as budgeting, planning, forecasting, financial and regulatory reporting, internal controls, risk management, procure-to-pay cycle, and compliance with contractual documents and government regulations. Ensure that company policies, procedures, and internal controls are followed as they relate to finance and accounting operations. Apply GAAP principles and direct finance team to ensure that annual revenue, expense, and capital budgeting processes are executed seamlessly. Prepare annual and other budgets and project future budgets and capital needs. Direct team to provide financial data and reports to use in conducting revenue and expense trend analysis. Hire additional finance department staff as needed. Telecommuting is available. Employer: Sega Sammy Creation USA, Inc. SSCUSAI/DOF/CA 11/8/23

title: Solar Energy Systems Engineer
description: Responsible for overseeing evaluation and regulation of energy efficiency within plans for solar energy systems, design, development, installation, and monitoring of solar photovoltaic systems within the legal framework of EPC (Engineering Precurement and Construction) environment for diesel hybrid systems, grid-tied energy solar PV systems, off-grid and standalone solar PV systems. Perform solar PV system monitoring including system performance, optimization, and feed-in tariff management. Perform site audits to gather and review data of systems. Oversee, review, and interpret electrical single-line diagrams and connection diagrams for solar systems. Oversee the legal regulatory management of load shedding contingency planning and management as well as load shifting and peak shaving through demand management and automatic surplus generation activation. Conduct energy audits for energy optimization and implementation of remedy measures. Salary: $74,300. Telecommuting is available. Employer: Bright Power, Inc. BPI/SESE/CA 10/31/23

title: Applications Developer
description: Applications Developer needed at AlpineReplay, Inc. dba Trace for its Austin, TX office. Full time, must have Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, or Computer Engineering. Duties: Analyze target users’ needs, and design, test and develop new and existing applications for the Android and IOS platforms from conceptualization to launch. Work with the Web development team and mobile engineers to specify algorithm requirements, and implement and test those APIs in collaboration with web and backend teams. Build algorithm and develop tools in performing tests and analysis for algorithm evaluations. Oversee mathematical statistics, tracking, and GPS systems. Develop Android and IOS multithreaded applications by developing, combining, and integrating the following modules, elements, and technologies: Native Android and iOS Code Modules; C++ and C Modules and libraries that work inside Android and IOS applications, SDK and other languages common for Android and iOS; internal databases that can be used with Android and iOS applications; integration of Bluetooth and Wi-Fi communication on multiple platforms; efficient use and integration of GPS and inertial sensor measurements; integration of maps from multitude of sources, voice, and video by using internal (mobile phone) and external sources; and efficient and reliable communication with the backend server. Estimate appropriate configuration parameters for the software application. Create a variety of models and diagrams (such as flowcharts) that instruct programmers how to write the software code. Design each piece of the program and plan how the pieces will work together. Conduct unit test of software applications using web-based or mobile-based platforms, and resolve problems encountered during various testing cycles. Document and present proposed methods and solutions using visual aids. Recommend updates for existing applications. Ensure that the software continues to function normally through software maintenance and testing. Document every aspect of the application or system as reference for future maintenance and upgrades. Collaborate with other computer specialists to create optimum software. Specify power supply requirements and configuration. Send resume/application to Chief Technology Officer (CTO) AlpineReplay, Inc. dba Trace, 16561 Bolsa Chica St. Suite 106, Huntington Beach, CA 92649. ARI/AD/CA 10/20/23

title: Technical Sales Specialist
description: Technical Sales Specialist needed at Nationwide Lighting & Electric Supply, Inc. Full-time position requires Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical Engineering or in Electronics & Communications Engineering and 1-year experience in technical sales. Duties: Analyze and establish the customers’ need by reviewing and interpreting technical specifications before recommending appropriate lighting and electric supply products offered by the company. Provide direct technical support to customers by assisting them in selecting lighting and electrical supply products based on their needs and product specifications, and applicable regulations. Explain product features to customers including the products’ capabilities and limitations. Answer inquiries and questions from customers related to ongoing use of lighting and electric supply products, maintenance requirements, operations, and other related information. Drive continued sales by checking customer purchasing history, suggesting new and related products, and explaining technical features. Obtain building blueprints or specifications for use by engineering department in bid preparations. Develop new accounts by researching and identifying potential leads, and soliciting new business by contacting existing and prospective customers, to discuss how specific products can meet their needs by providing technical information and advice. Provide customers with product information, price, availability, and credit/payment terms. Finalize orders and transfer them to fulfillment to be filled. Communicate and coordinate with customers about delivery schedules, service contracts, warranties, and other information related to purchased products. Inform customers about issues related to responsible use and disposal of lighting and electric supply products, such as waste reduction or product or byproduct recycling or disposal. Maintain accurate, organized paper and digital customer records. Send resume/application to President, Nationwide Lighting & Electric Supply, Inc., 12310 Woodruff Avenue, Downey, CA 90241. NLESI/TSS/CA 10/18/23

title: Software Engineer
description: Full-time, needed at Eccentex Corporation, must have Master of Science in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or equivalent. Duties: Responsible for the overall performance of the AppBase platform in meeting nonfunctional system requirements around response time/throughput, systems availability, replication, caching, and scalability, among others. Evaluate and analyze the client's business requirements to determine the feasibility of design within time and cost constraints and within an application area, and the desirability of incorporating them into the design of the web-based CMS (Case Management System) application using the AppBase platform. Develop distributed, multitiered solutions on the .NET platform, including the design, development, and maintenance of several components of the AppBase platform architecture, i.e., Content Viewer, Content Management Service, Document Distribution Service, Desktop Viewer, Message Bus Service, Content Transformation Service, Capture Service, Storage Service. Design end-to-end CMS system applications by developing web parts, creating custom lists, developing workflows and custom dashboards, developing links, merging and aggregating custom views for various data sources, and establishing metadata fields with document sets, and internal and external content types. Navigate technical challenges including the development of a highly efficient dynamic content delivery AppBase platform integrated with social media and personalization services. Ensure all CMS components fit with the strategic direction of the customer and with hardware/network, and system infrastructure to include and support a highly scalable elastic cloud computing technology. Create web software development standards and modular architectures for code reuse and engineering best practices, and provide detailed architectural diagrams and standard documents. Modify existing software to correct errors, allow it to adapt to new hardware or to improve its performance, resolve design and client testing issues, and be responsible for detecting deficiencies, recommending improvements, and assessing change impacts within the current solution area. Work with the clients' project manager to review business drivers, needs and strategies, and understand implications of architectural decision, issues, and plans to the application structure. Prepare functional specifications that can be easily understood by customers and internal development teams, and create User Guide, Administration Guide, and Installation and Configuration Guides. Conduct and manage the deployment and configuration of the application to HPD production environment and ensure the completeness and accuracy of data and image migration into the new production environment/platform/system. Provide onsite training for trainers and one-on-one Administrator training solutions for each of the HPD Solution Administrators, including technical support, troubleshooting, and repair. Send resume/application by postal mail to CFO, Eccentex Corp., 6101 W. Centinela Ave.# 110, Culver City, CA 90230. EC/SE/CA 8/11/23
